section_1.rst.summary: These changes could possibly break your code, so you need to keep track of them. Please see GSApplication.versionNumber for how to check for the app version in your code.

section_3.rst.summary: The active GSDocument object or None.

section_4.rst.summary: An array of open GSDocument objects.

section_5.rst.summary: The active GSFont object or None.

section_6.rst.summary: Be aware that the order is defined by last used font. Append and extend generally don't insert at the end of the list.

section_7.rst.summary: List of available reporter plug-ins (same as bottom section in the 'View' menu). These are the actual objects.

section_9.rst.summary: List of available filters (same as 'Filter' menu). These are the actual objects.

section_10.rst.summary: A dict like object for storing preferences. You can get and set key-value pairs.

section_11.rst.summary: Access to default settings cast to a bool.

section_12.rst.summary: A dictionary with script name to tag mapping, e.g., 'arabic': 'arab' or 'devanagari': 'dev2'

section_13.rst.summary: A dictionary with glyphs name suffixes for scripts and their respective script names, e.g., 'cy': 'cyrillic'

section_14.rst.summary: A dictionary with language tag to script tag mapping, e.g., 'ENG': 'latn'

section_15.rst.summary: A list of dictionaries with more detailed language informations.

section_17.rst.summary: Width of glyph Edit view. Corresponds to the "Width of editor" setting from the Preferences.

section_18.rst.summary: Size of Bezier handles in Glyph Edit view. Possible value are 0–2.

section_19.rst.summary: String containing Glyph.app’s version number. May contain letters also, like ‘2.3b’.

section_20.rst.summary: Glyph.app’s version number. Use this to check for version in your code.

section_22.rst.summary: Add menu items to Glyphs’ main menus.

section_26.rst.summary: Shows the Glyph Info window with a preset search string

section_27.rst.summary: Generates GSGlyphInfo object for a given glyph name.

section_28.rst.summary: Generates GSGlyphInfo object for a given hex unicode.

section_29.rst.summary: Converts glyph name to nice, human-readable glyph name (e.g. afii10017 or uni0410 to A-cy)

section_30.rst.summary: Converts glyph name to production glyph name (e.g. afii10017 or A-cy to uni0410)

section_31.rst.summary: If defined as a ligature in the glyph database, this function returns a list of glyph names that this ligature could be composed of.

section_32.rst.summary: Add a user-defined function to the glyph window’s drawing operations, in the foreground and background for the active glyph as well as in the inactive glyphs.

section_33.rst.summary: Remove the function you’ve previously added.

section_34.rst.summary: Redraws all Edit views and Preview views.

section_35.rst.summary: Shows the user a notification in Mac’s Notification Center.

section_36.rst.summary: Return a string in the language of Glyphs.app’s UI locale, which must be supplied as a dictionary using language codes as keys.

section_37.rst.summary: Activate a reporter plug-in by its object (see Glyphs.reporters) or class name.

section_38.rst.summary: Deactivate a reporter plug-in by its object (see Glyphs.reporters) or class name.

section_42.rst.summary: Implementation of the font object. This object is host to the masters <GSFontMaster> used for interpolation.

section_43.rst.summary: Returns the internal NSDocument document. Read-only.

section_50.rst.summary: The numbers. A list of GSMetric objects.

section_51.rst.summary: Collection of GSGlyph objects. Returns a list, but you may also call glyphs using index or glyph name or character as key.

section_52.rst.summary: The (internal) character that is used in the edit view. It the glyph has a unicode, that is used, otherwise a temporary code is assigned.

section_53.rst.summary: Collection of GSClass objects, representing OpenType glyph classes.

section_54.rst.summary: Collection of GSFeature objects, representing OpenType features.

section_55.rst.summary: Collection of GSFeaturePrefix objects, containing stuff that needs to be outside of the OpenType features.

section_81.rst.summary: Kerning for LTR writing A multi-level dictionary. The first level’s key is the GSFontMaster.id (each master has its own kerning), the second level’s key is the GSGlyph.id or class id (@MMK_L_XX) of the first glyph, the third level’s key is a glyph id or class id (@MMK_R_XX) for the second glyph.

section_82.rst.summary: Kerning for RTL writing A multi-level dictionary. The first level’s key is the GSFontMaster.id (each master has its own kerning), the second level’s key is the GSGlyph.id or class id (@MMK_L_XX) of the first glyph, the third level’s key is a glyph id or class id (@MMK_R_XX) for the second glyph.

section_83.rst.summary: Kerning for vertical writing A multi-level dictionary. The first level’s key is the GSFontMaster.id (each master has its own kerning), the second level’s key is the GSGlyph.id or class id (@MMK_L_XX) of the first glyph, the third level’s key is a glyph id or class id (@MMK_R_XX) for the second glyph.

section_84.rst.summary: A dictionary to store user data. Use a unique key and only use objects that can be stored in a property list (string, list, dict, numbers, NSData) otherwise the data will not be recoverable from the saved file.

section_85.rst.summary: A dictionary to store data temporarily. Use a unique key.

section_86.rst.summary: Corresponds to the “Don't use nice names” setting from the Font Info dialog.

section_87.rst.summary: The custom parameters. List of GSCustomParameter objects.

section_88.rst.summary: Corresponds to the “Grid spacing” setting from the Info dialog.

section_89.rst.summary: Corresponds to the “Grid sub divisions” setting from the Info dialog.

section_90.rst.summary: Ready calculated size of grid for rounding purposes. Result of division of grid with gridSubDivisions.

section_92.rst.summary: Distance of movement by arrow keys. Default:1

section_93.rst.summary: Distance of movement by arrow plus Shift key. Default:10

section_94.rst.summary: Distance of movement by arrow plus Command key. Default:100

section_95.rst.summary: disable snapping to nodes and background

section_97.rst.summary: Returns a list of all selected glyphs in the Font View.

section_98.rst.summary: Returns a list of all selected layers in the active tab.

section_99.rst.summary: Returns the active master (selected in the toolbar).

section_100.rst.summary: Returns the index of the active master (selected in the toolbar).

section_102.rst.summary: List of open Edit view tabs in UI, as list of GSEditViewController objects.

section_106.rst.summary: Name of tool selected in toolbar.

section_107.rst.summary: Returns a list of available tool names, including third-party plug-ins.

section_108.rst.summary: Returns the version that the file was last saved

section_109.rst.summary: The file-format the font should be written. possible values are '2' and '3'

section_113.rst.summary: Makes font visible in the application, either by bringing an already open font window to the front or by appending a formerly invisible font object (such as the result of a copy() operation) as a window to the application.

section_114.rst.summary: This returns the kerning value for the two specified glyphs (leftKey or rightKey is the glyph name) or a kerning group key (@MMK_X_XX).

section_115.rst.summary: This sets the kerning for the two specified glyphs (leftKey or rightKey is the glyph name) or a kerning group key (@MMK_X_XX).

section_116.rst.summary: Removes the kerning for the two specified glyphs (LeftKey or RightKey is the glyph name) or a kerning group key (@MMK_X_XX).

section_117.rst.summary: Opens a new tab in the current document window, optionally with text, and return that tab object

section_118.rst.summary: Updates all OpenType features and classes at once, including generating necessary new features and classes. Equivalent to the "Update" button in the features panel.

section_119.rst.summary: Compiles the features, thus making the new feature code functionally available in the editor. Equivalent to the "Compile" button in the features panel.

section_138.rst.summary: Reference to the GSFont object that contains the master. Normally that is set by the app, only if the instance is not actually added to the font, then set this manually.

section_142.rst.summary: List of floats specifying the positions for each axis

section_253.rst.summary: List of Feature names for stylistic set features

section_254.rst.summary: A dictionary to store data temporarily. Use a unique key.

section_257.rst.summary: The layers of the glyph, collection of GSLayer objects. You can access them either by index or by layer ID, which can be a GSFontMaster.id.

section_258.rst.summary: The name of the glyph. It will be converted to a "nice name" (afii10017 to A-cy) (you can disable this behavior in font info or the app preference)

section_259.rst.summary: String with the hex Unicode value of glyph, if encoded.

section_260.rst.summary: List of Strings‚ with the hex Unicode values of glyph, if encoded.

section_261.rst.summary: String representation of glyph, if encoded. This is similar to the string representation that you get when copying glyphs into the clipboard.

section_262.rst.summary: An unique identifier for each glyph

section_263.rst.summary: If the glyph is locked TODO

section_264.rst.summary: The category of the glyph. e.g.

section_265.rst.summary: Set to True in order to manipulate the GSGlyph.category of the glyph (see above). Makes it possible to ship custom glyph data inside a .glyphs file without a separate GlyphData file.

section_266.rst.summary: The subCategory of the glyph. e.g.

section_267.rst.summary: Set to True in order to manipulate the GSGlyph.subCategory of the glyph (see above). Makes it possible to ship custom glyph data inside a .glyphs file without a separate GlyphData file.

section_269.rst.summary: Set to True in order to manipulate the GSGlyph.case of the glyph (see above). Makes it possible to ship custom glyph data inside a .glyphs file without a separate GlyphData file.

section_271.rst.summary: Set to True in order to manipulate the GSGlyph.direction of the glyph (see above). Makes it possible to ship custom glyph data inside a .glyphs file without a separate GlyphData file.

section_272.rst.summary: The script of the glyph, e.g., 'latin', 'arabic'. Setting only works if GSGlyph.storeScript is set (see below).

section_273.rst.summary: Set to True in order to manipulate the GSGlyph.script of the glyph (see above). Makes it possible to ship custom glyph data inside a .glyphs file without a separate GlyphData file.

section_274.rst.summary: The productionName of the glyph. Setting only works if GSGlyph.storeProductionName is set (see below).

section_275.rst.summary: Set to True in order to manipulate the GSGlyph.productionName of the glyph (see above). Makes it possible to ship custom glyph data inside a .glyphs file without a separate GlyphData file.

section_276.rst.summary: store strings that can be used to filter glyphs or build OT-classes with token filters

section_278.rst.summary: Alternative name of glyph used for sorting in UI.

section_279.rst.summary: Alternative name of glyph used for sorting in UI, when using 'Keep Alternates Next to Base Glyph' from Font Info. see GSGlyph.storeSortName

section_280.rst.summary: Set to True in order to manipulate the GSGlyph.sortName and GSGlyph.sortNameKeep of the glyph (see above). Makes it possible to ship custom glyph data inside a .glyphs file without a separate GlyphData file.

section_281.rst.summary: The leftKerningGroup of the glyph. All glyphs with the same text in the kerning group end up in the same kerning class.

section_282.rst.summary: The rightKerningGroup of the glyph. All glyphs with the same text in the kerning group end up in the same kerning class.

section_283.rst.summary: The topKerningGroup of the glyph. All glyphs with the same text in the kerning group end up in the same kerning class.

section_284.rst.summary: The bottomKerningGroup of the glyph. All glyphs with the same text in the kerning group end up in the same kerning class.

section_285.rst.summary: The key to be used with the kerning functions (GSFont.kerningForPair(), GSFont.setKerningForPair(), GSFont.removeKerningForPair()).

section_286.rst.summary: The key to be used with the kerning functions (GSFont.kerningForPair(), GSFont.setKerningForPair()GSFont.removeKerningForPair()).

section_287.rst.summary: The key to be used with the kerning functions (GSFont.kerningForPair(), GSFont.setKerningForPair(), GSFont.removeKerningForPair()).

section_288.rst.summary: The key to be used with the kerning functions (GSFont.kerningForPair(), GSFont.setKerningForPair(), GSFont.removeKerningForPair()).

section_289.rst.summary: The leftMetricsKey of the glyph. This is a reference to another glyph by name or formula.

section_290.rst.summary: The rightMetricsKey of the glyph. This is a reference to another glyph by name or formula.

section_291.rst.summary: The widthMetricsKey of the glyph. This is a reference to another glyph by name or formula.

section_293.rst.summary: Color marking of glyph in UI

section_294.rst.summary: NSColor object of glyph color, useful for drawing in plugins.

section_296.rst.summary: Return True if the Glyph is selected in the Font View. This is different to the property font.selectedLayers which returns the selection from the active tab.

section_297.rst.summary: Return True when all layers in this glyph are compatible (same components, anchors, paths etc.)

section_298.rst.summary: A dictionary to store user data. Use a unique key and only use objects that can be stored in a property list (string, list, dict, numbers, NSData) otherwise the data will not be recoverable from the saved file.

section_300.rst.summary: Change date when glyph was last changed as datetime.

section_302.rst.summary: Call this before you do a longer running change to the glyph. Be extra careful to call glyph.endUndo() <GSGlyph.endUndo()> when you are finished.

section_303.rst.summary: This closes a undo group that was opened by a previous call of glyph.beginUndo() <GSGlyph.beginUndo()> Make sure that you call this for each beginUndo() call.

section_304.rst.summary: Updates all information like name, unicode etc. for this glyph.

section_305.rst.summary: Duplicate the glyph under a new name and return it.

section_307.rst.summary: Reference to the glyph <GSGlyph> object that this layer is attached to.

section_309.rst.summary: Master that this layer is connected to. Read only.

section_310.rst.summary: The ID of the fontMaster <GSFontMaster> this layer belongs to, in case this isn't a master layer. Every layer that isn't a master layer needs to be attached to one master layer.

section_311.rst.summary: The unique layer ID is used to access the layer in the glyphs <GSGlyph> layer dictionary.

section_312.rst.summary: layer attributes like axisRules, coordinates, colorPalette, sbixSize, color, svg

section_313.rst.summary: Color marking of glyph in UI

section_314.rst.summary: NSColor object of layer color, useful for drawing in plugins.

section_315.rst.summary: Collection of GSComponent objects. This is only a helper proxy to iterate all components (without paths).

section_320.rst.summary: List of GSShape objects. That are most likely GSPath or GSComponent

section_321.rst.summary: List of GSPath objects. This is only a helper proxy to iterate all paths (without components).

section_322.rst.summary: List of all selected objects in the glyph.

section_332.rst.summary: The leftMetricsKey of the layer. This is a reference to another glyph by name or formula.

section_333.rst.summary: The rightMetricsKey of the layer. This is a reference to another glyph by name or formula.

section_334.rst.summary: The widthMetricsKey of the layer. This is a reference to another glyph by name or formula.

section_335.rst.summary: Bounding box of whole glyph as NSRect. Read-only.

section_336.rst.summary: Bounding box of the layer’s selection (nodes, anchors, components etc). Read-only.

section_337.rst.summary: The metrics layer are a list of horizontal metrics filtered specifically for this layer. Use this instead of master.alignmentZones <GSFontMaster.alignmentZones>.

section_339.rst.summary: The background image. It will be scaled so that 1 em unit equals 1 of the image’s pixels.

section_340.rst.summary: The layer as an NSBezierPath object. Useful for drawing glyphs in plug-ins.

section_341.rst.summary: All open paths of the layer as an NSBezierPath object. Useful for drawing glyphs as outlines in plug-ins.

section_342.rst.summary: The layer as an NSBezierPath object including paths from components. Useful for drawing glyphs in plug-ins.

section_343.rst.summary: All open paths of the layer as an NSBezierPath object including paths from components. Useful for drawing glyphs as outlines in plugins.

section_344.rst.summary: Indicates if the components are auto aligned.

section_345.rst.summary: If the layer is a brace, bracket or a smart component layer

section_346.rst.summary: If it is a master layer

section_347.rst.summary: The italic angle that applies to this layer

section_348.rst.summary: if the layer is visible (the eye icon in the layer panel)

section_349.rst.summary: A dictionary to store user data. Use a unique key and only use objects that can be stored in a property list (string, list, dict, numbers, NSData) otherwise the data will not be recoverable from the saved file.

section_350.rst.summary: A dictionary to store data temporarily. Use a unique key.

section_351.rst.summary: Maps this layer to the poles on the interpolation axes of the Smart Glyph. The dictionary keys are the names of the GSSmartComponentAxis objects.

section_353.rst.summary: Add nodes at layer’s extrema, e.g., top, bottom etc.

section_354.rst.summary: Apply a transformation matrix to the layer.

section_355.rst.summary: Apply a NSAffineTransform to the layer.

section_356.rst.summary: Call this before you do bigger changes to the Layer. This will increase performance and prevent undo problems.

section_358.rst.summary: Cuts all paths that intersect the line from Point1 to Point2

section_369.rst.summary: A dictionary to store user data. Use a unique key and only use objects that can be stored in a property list (string, list, dict, numbers, NSData) otherwise the data will not be recoverable from the saved file.

section_376.rst.summary: The glyph name the component is pointing to.

section_379.rst.summary: The GSLayer the component is pointing to. This is read-only.

section_382.rst.summary: Defines whether the component is automatically aligned.

section_386.rst.summary: Selection state of component in UI.

section_387.rst.summary: attributes attributes like mask or reversePaths

section_388.rst.summary: Dictionary of interpolations values of the Smart Component. Key are the axis.id, values are between the top and the bottom value of the corresponding GSSmartComponentAxis objects.

section_389.rst.summary: The component as an NSBezierPath object. Useful for drawing glyphs in plugins.

section_390.rst.summary: A dictionary to store user data. Use a unique key and only use objects that can be stored in a property list (string, list, dict, numbers, NSData) otherwise the data will not be recoverable from the saved file.

section_391.rst.summary: A dictionary to store data temporarily. Use a unique key.

section_393.rst.summary: Apply a transformation matrix to the component.

section_395.rst.summary: a small helper class to store a reference to a glyph in userData that will keep track of changes to the glyph name.

section_397.rst.summary: Implementation of the Smart Component interpolation axis object. For details on how to access them, please see GSGlyph.smartComponentAxes

section_398.rst.summary: Name of the axis. The name is for display purpose only.

section_399.rst.summary: Id of the axis. This Id will be used to map the Smart Glyph’s layers to the poles of the interpolation.

section_400.rst.summary: Top end (pole) value on interpolation axis.

section_401.rst.summary: Bottom end (pole) value on interpolation axis.

section_402.rst.summary: Implementation of the shape object. This a superclass for GSPath and GSComponent.

section_404.rst.summary: the type of the shapes. can be GSShapeTypePath or GSShapeTypeComponent

section_408.rst.summary: A list of segments as NSPoint objects. Two objects represent a line, four represent a curve.

section_409.rst.summary: Returns True if the the path is closed

section_410.rst.summary: Path direction. -1 for counter clockwise, 1 for clockwise.

section_411.rst.summary: Bounding box of the path, read-only

section_412.rst.summary: Selection state of path in UI.

section_413.rst.summary: The same path as an NSBezierPath object. Useful for drawing glyphs in plugins.

section_414.rst.summary: path attributes like fill, mask, strokeWidth, strokeHeight, strokeColor', strokePos

section_415.rst.summary: A dictionary to store data temporarily. Use a unique key.

section_417.rst.summary: Add nodes at path’s extrema, e.g., top, bottom etc.

section_418.rst.summary: Apply a transformation matrix to the path.

section_421.rst.summary: The type of the node, LINE, CURVE or OFFCURVE

section_422.rst.summary: If it is a smooth connection or not

section_423.rst.summary: The type of the connection, SHARP or SMOOTH

section_424.rst.summary: Selection state of node in UI.

section_427.rst.summary: Returns the previous node in the path.

section_428.rst.summary: Attaches a name to a node.

section_429.rst.summary: If the position of the node is relative to the LSB (0), center (2) or RSB (1).

section_430.rst.summary: A dictionary to store user data. Use a unique key and only use objects that can be stored in a property list (string, list, dict, numbers, NSData) otherwise the data will not be recoverable from the saved file.

section_433.rst.summary: The type of the node, LINE, CURVE or QCURVE

section_440.rst.summary: A filter to only show the guide in certain glyphs. Only relevant in global guides

section_441.rst.summary: If the guide is showing measurements

section_442.rst.summary: A dictionary to store user data. Use a unique key and only use objects that can be stored in a property list (string, list, dict, numbers, NSData) otherwise the data will not be recoverable from the saved file.

section_446.rst.summary: The content of the annotation. Only useful if type == TEXT

section_451.rst.summary: The first node the hint is attached to.

section_452.rst.summary: The the second node this hint is attached to. In the case of a ghost hint, this value will be empty.

section_453.rst.summary: A third node this hint is attached to. Used for Interpolation or Diagonal hints.

section_454.rst.summary: A fourth node this hint is attached to. Used for Diagonal hints.

section_455.rst.summary: The indexPath to the first node the hint is attached to.

section_456.rst.summary: The indexPath to the second node this hint is attached to. In the case of a ghost hint, this value will be empty.

section_457.rst.summary: A indexPath to the third node this hint is attached to. Used for Interpolation or Diagonal hints.

section_458.rst.summary: A indexPath to the fourth node this hint is attached to. Used for Diagonal hints.

section_460.rst.summary: Stores extra options for the hint. For TT hints, that might be the rounding settings.

section_461.rst.summary: True if hint is horizontal, False if vertical.

section_462.rst.summary: Selection state of hint in UI.

section_463.rst.summary: Name of the hint. This is the referenced glyph for corner and cap components.

section_464.rst.summary: Index of TrueType stem that this hint is attached to. The stems are defined in the custom parameter "TTFStems" per master.

section_465.rst.summary: if it is a TrueType instruction

section_466.rst.summary: if it is a PostScript hint

section_467.rst.summary: if it is a Corner (or Cap, Brush...) component

section_468.rst.summary: A dictionary to store data temporarily. Use a unique key.

section_472.rst.summary: Crop rectangle. This is relative to the image size in pixels, not the font’s em units (just in case the image is scaled to something other than 100%).

section_473.rst.summary: Defines whether image is locked for access in UI.

section_474.rst.summary: Defines the transparence of the image in the Edit view. Default is 50%, possible values are 10–100.

section_475.rst.summary: Position of image in font units.

section_480.rst.summary: Resets the cropping to the image’s original dimensions.

section_481.rst.summary: Scale the image’s cropped width to a certain em unit value, retaining its aspect ratio.

section_482.rst.summary: Scale the image’s cropped height to a certain em unit value, retaining its aspect ratio.

section_484.rst.summary: A list of colors. Each is an list containing a NSColor and and position between 0.0 and 1.0.

section_486.rst.summary: A NSPoint that relatively to the shapes bounding box defines the starting point of the gradient

section_487.rst.summary: A NSPoint that relatively to the shapes bounding box defines the ending point of the gradient

section_488.rst.summary: A NSPoint of the absolute starting point of the gradient

section_489.rst.summary: A NSPoint of the absolute ending point of the gradient

section_490.rst.summary: Implementation of the GSEditViewController object, which represents Edit tabs in the UI.

section_491.rst.summary: The GSFont object that this tab belongs to.

section_492.rst.summary: The text of the tab, either as text, or slash-escaped glyph names, or mixed. OpenType features will be applied after the text has been changed.

section_493.rst.summary: The plain underlying string of the tab

section_494.rst.summary: The index of the active master (selected in the toolbar).

section_495.rst.summary: Alternatively, you can set (and read) a list of GSLayer objects. These can be any of the layers of a glyph.

section_497.rst.summary: Scale (zoom factor) of the Edit view. Useful for drawing activity in plugins.

section_498.rst.summary: The visible area of the Edit view in screen pixel coordinates (view coordinates).

section_499.rst.summary: Bounding box of all glyphs in the Edit view in view coordinate values.

section_500.rst.summary: Position of the active layer’s origin (0,0) relative to the origin of the view plane (see bounds <GSEditViewController.bounds>), in view coordinates.

section_501.rst.summary: Position of text cursor in text, starting with 0.

section_502.rst.summary: Amount of selected glyphs in text, starting at cursor position (see above).

section_503.rst.summary: Position of cursor in the layers list, starting with 0.

section_505.rst.summary: List of OpenType features applied to text in Edit view.

section_506.rst.summary: A dictionary to store data temporarily. Use a unique key.

section_507.rst.summary: Instances to show in the Preview area.

section_508.rst.summary: Height of the preview panel in the Edit view in pixels.

section_509.rst.summary: Height of the little toolbar at the very bottom of the window. Read-only.

section_512.rst.summary: Save the view to a PDF file.

section_513.rst.summary: forces a update of the edit view

section_516.rst.summary: Production name of glyph. Will return a value only if production name differs from nice name, otherwise None.

section_517.rst.summary: This is mostly from the UnicodeData.txt file from unicode.org. Some corrections have been made (Accents, ...) e.g: "Letter", "Number", "Punctuation", "Mark", "Separator", "Symbol", "Other"

section_530.rst.summary: Alternative names for glyphs that are not used, but should be recognized (e.g., for conversion to nice names).

section_535.rst.summary: the value that is considered the default (either the dflt or English entry)

section_546.rst.summary: The name of the metric value. Eg.

section_552.rst.summary: The index of the selected instance

section_559.rst.summary: if a single number, scale uniformly, otherwise scale by x, y if center is given, that is used as the origin of the scale

section_560.rst.summary: The angle of the rotation. In degree, positive angles are CCW if center is given, that is used as the origin of the rotation

section_561.rst.summary: if a single number, skew in x-direction otherwise skew by x, y if center is given, that is used as the origin of the skew
